From sporadic@fuckedcompany.com Wed Oct 30 21:38:11 2002 Return-Path: Delivered-To: yyyy@localhost.spamassassin.taint.org Received: from localhost (jalapeno [127.0.0.1]) by jmason.org (Postfix) with ESMTP id 6BB6616F1A for ; Wed, 30 Oct 2002 21:37:28 +0000 (GMT) Received: from jalapeno [127.0.0.1] by localhost with IMAP (fetchmail-5.9.0) for jm@localhost (single-drop); Wed, 30 Oct 2002 21:37:28 +0000 (GMT) Received: from nycsmtp3out.rdc-nyc.rr.com (nycsmtp3out.rdc-nyc.rr.com [24.29.99.228]) by dogma.slashnull.org (8.11.6/8.11.6) with ESMTP id g9ULO7W09093 for ; Wed, 30 Oct 2002 21:24:08 GMT Received: from fuckedcompany.com (66-108-219-157.nyc.rr.com [66.108.219.157]) by nycsmtp3out.rdc-nyc.rr.com (8.12.1/Road Runner SMTP Server 1.0) with SMTP id g9ULPO0O017336 for ; Wed, 30 Oct 2002 16:25:28 -0500 (EST) Message-Id: <200210302125.g9ULPO0O017336@nycsmtp3out.rdc-nyc.rr.com> From: "pud" To: Subject: FC Sporadic for Wednesday, October 30, 2002 Sender: "pud" MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="= Multipart Boundary 1030021620" Date: Wed, 30 Oct 2002 16:20:30 -0500 This is a multipart MIME message. --= Multipart Boundary 1030021620 Content-Type: text/plain; charset="ISO-8859-1" Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit FC Sporadic Hi,
Check out my new site,
InternalMemos.com
Over 980 internal memos, updated daily.
Recent highlights include:

A&P: Salary, hiring freeze
$Exodus: Rumors, rumors, rumors
MSNBC: Sniper, parties, other news
$Ebay: San Jose office moving?
$EDS: Incentive & bonus changes
Adobe: Workforce Realignment/Reduction
$Lycos: Frank Weller resignation
AOL: Past, present, and future
TenFold: Reorganization
Ebay: Meg addresses allegations
$ Verisign: Third-party phase-out
$ Ericsson: Market unstable, moving on

More internal memos...


Let me first welcome all the new people to the Sporadic -- there were a bunch of people who signed up a while ago but never got added until today, I think the problems have been fixed. There are currently over 250,000 subscribers to this list (dayam!). Of those, I think there are around 5 people who actually read it.

So anyway, raise your hand if you're older than 30 and have never been married.

Unless I meet the girl of my dreams tomorrow (which is unlikely as I don't plan on leaving my apartment tomorrow, much less wearing pants anytime in the near future), looks like I'm headed in that direction.

I never think about it but it seems I'm supposed to. I definitely don't want to be one of those guys who's a bachelor for life, and I eventually want kids, I think that's cool! But today, October 30, 2002, is my 27th birthday.

To celebrate, I bought myself some Rogain, tooth whitener, and a gym membership. My detergent makes the skin on my back hurt and I still have zits. Oh hey I bought a new guitar and played dress up, that was fun.

It's 4:00 AM and I'm eating expired ham. Somehow I'm able to write a newsletter to 250,000 people, yet my birthday plans involve sitting home alone teaching myself Journey songs on the guitar. then Blockbuster and Chinese delivery. Woohoo!

Anyway, thanks for being there.

Rock on,
pud

ps- man, this new Sporadic layout is a little too cheery, don't you think? blah, i'll fix it later.
pps- if you need web hosting or are a hosting provider, check out my new site Bizient.com


Here are some of today's newest fucks. As usual, more new ones on the site daily.
http://www.fuckedcompany.com/

Booyah
Wowwwww..... this internal memo sent to Clifford Chance LLP employees lists a ton of "problem areas", complaints and comments... Highlights include, "If the assigning system isn't corrupt, ask yourself: why aren't attractive female associates ever out of work?" and "Not only is he dishonest, but he behaves completely inappropriately with female associates working under him".. and so on.
When: 10/30/2002
Company: Clifford Chance LLP
Points: 135


Grrr
Vignette to Acquire Epicentric. Here's the news, and of course here's the internal memo that was sent to employees. From one FC reader and pissed-off employee who worked hard for his options, "Here's my favorite one. Q. What will happen to my Epicentric employee stock options? A. Once the purchase of Epicentric is complete, Epicentric stock options will be cancelled."
When: 10/30/2002
Company: Epicentric
Points: 185


Limb
Bausch and Lomb CEO denied $1.1 million bonus for falsely claiming to have completed a masters degree. What a fuckbasket cock-socket he is.
When: 10/30/2002
Company: Bausch & Lomb
Points: 115


Cleanup, isle four
Salary and hiring freeze at A&P supermarkets, here's the internal memo sent to employees.
When: 10/30/2002
Company: A&P
Points: 120


CyaNow
Okee I reported yesterday that CDNow was set to layoff 60 people... well rumor has it the axe just fell and the *entire* programming staff was let go. Whether this means the company is shutting down or they're just being replaced by cheaper consultants remains to be seen...
When: 10/30/2002
Company: CdNow
Points: 169


Sore
Rumor has it Kestrel Solutions filed Chapter 11 today. Anyone need a sweet deal on a bit-rate independent multiplexer? uhh.. didnt think so.
When: 10/30/2002
Company: Kestrel Solutions
Points: 165


XXX
Rumor has it massive layoffs in the pipline at Xerox. Word is high-ranking managers are having assignments removed, work load reduced, etc... Sometime mid-next week is said to be d-day.
When: 10/30/2002
Company: Xerox
Points: 143

Copyright 2002. too tired to think of anything creative. thanks for reading tho :) --= Multipart Boundary 1030021620 Content-Type: text/html; charset="ISO-8859-1" Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit FC Sporadic Hi,
